Submodules

qns.entity.base_channel module

class qns.entity.base_channel.BaseChannel(name: str, **kwargs: Unpack[BaseChannelInitKwargs])[source]

Bases: Entity, Generic[NodeT]

find_peer(own: NodeT) → NodeT[source]

Return the node in node_list that is not own.

Raises:

ValueError – node_list does not have two nodes, or own is not one of them.

install(simulator: Simulator) → None[source]

install is called before simulator runs to initialize or set initial events

Parameters:

simulator (Simulator) – the simulator

class qns.entity.base_channel.BaseChannelInitKwargs[source]

Bases: TypedDict

bandwidth: int

Bandwidth in bytes/qubits per second. 0 means infinite.

delay: float | DelayModel

Propagation delay in seconds or a DelayModel instance. Default is inferred from link length and speed of light, or 0 if link length is unset.

drop_rate: float

Packet/photon loss probability. 0 means never, 1 means always.

length: float

Link length in kilometers.

max_buffer_size: int

Maximum buffer size in bytes/qubits. 0 means infinite. Packets/photons queued due to bandwidth limitation are placed in the buffer. If the buffer is full, the next packet/photon is dropped.

exception qns.entity.base_channel.NextHopNotConnectionException[source]

Bases: Exception

qns.entity.base_channel.default_light_speed: float = 200000.0

Default speed of light in km/s. Initial value is 200000 km/s, the speed of light in fiber optics.

qns.entity.base_channel.set_default_light_speed(light_speed: float) → None[source]

Change default speed of light in km/s.

qns.entity.entity module

class qns.entity.entity.Entity(name: str)[source]

Bases: object

This is the basic entity class, including memories, channels and nodes.

handle(event: Event) → None[source]

handle is called to process an receiving Event.

Parameters:

event (qns.simulator.event.Event) – the event that send to this entity

install is called before simulator runs to initialize or set initial events. For Node objects, it’s called from Network.install()

Parameters:

simulator (qns.simulator.simulator.Simulator) – the simulator

property simulator: Simulator

Return the Simulator that this entity belongs to.

Raises:

IndexError - simulator does not exist –

Module contents

class qns.entity.Application[source]

Bases: object

Application can be deployed on the quantum nodes.

add_handler(handler: Callable[[EventT], bool | None], EventTypeList: type[EventT] | list[type[EventT]] = [], ByList: list[Any] = [])[source]

Add a handler function to the dispatcher.

Parameters:

  • handler – The handler to process the event. It is an object method that accepts the event.

  • EventTypeList – a list of Event Class Type. An empty list meaning to match all events.

  • ByList – a list of Entities, QNodes or Applications, that generates this event. An empty list meaning to match all entities.

get_node(*, node_type: type[NodeT] | None = None) → NodeT[source]

Get the node that runs this application

Returns:

the quantum node

handle(event: Event) → bool | None[source]

Process the event on the node.

Parameters:

event (Event) – the event

Returns:

if skip is True, further applications will not handle this event

Return type:

skip (bool, None)

handle_sync_signal(signal_type: SignalTypeEnum)[source]

Invoked after receiving a sync signal.

install(node: Node, simulator: Simulator)[source]

Install initial events for this Node. Called from Node.install()

Parameters:

  • node (Node) – the node that will run this application

  • simulator (Simulator) – the simulator

property simulator: Simulator

Get the simulator

Returns:

the simulator

property sync_current_phase: SignalTypeEnum

Phase set from last sync signal, only relevant with SYNC timing mode.

class qns.entity.Monitor(name: str, network: QuantumNetwork | None = None)[source]

Bases: Entity

add_attribution(name: str, calculate_func: Callable[[Simulator, QuantumNetwork | None, Event], Any]) → None[source]

Set an attribution that will be recorded. For example, an attribution could be the throughput or the fidelity.

Parameters:

  • name – column name, e.g., fidelity, throughput, time.

  • calculate_func – a function to calculate the value.

Usage:

m = Monitor()

# record the event happening time m.add_attribution(“time”, lambda s,n,e: e.t)

# get the ‘name’ attribution of the last node m.add_attribution(“count”, lambda s,network,e: network.nodes[-1].name)

at_event(event_type: type[Event]) → None[source]

Watch network status whenever the event happens.

Parameters:

event_type (Event) – the watched event.

Usage:

# record network status when a node receives a qubit m.at_event(RecvQubitPacket)

at_finish() → None[source]

Watch the final status after the simulation.

This does not work in a continuous simulation or if the simulation is stopped with Simulator.stop().

at_period(period_time: float) → None[source]

Watch network status at a constant interval.

Parameters:

period_time (float) – the interval in seconds.

Usage:

# record network status every 3 seconds. m.at_period(3)

at_start() → None[source]

Watch the initial status before the simulation starts.

get_data() → DataFrame[source]

Retrieve the collected data.

handle(event: Event) → None[source]

handle is called to process an receiving Event.

Parameters:

event (qns.simulator.event.Event) – the event that send to this entity

install(simulator: Simulator) → None[source]

install is called before simulator runs to initialize or set initial events. For Node objects, it’s called from Network.install()

Parameters:

simulator (qns.simulator.simulator.Simulator) – the simulator

class qns.entity.QuantumChannel(name: str, **kwargs: Unpack[QuantumChannelInitKwargs])[source]

Bases: BaseChannel[QNode]

QuantumChannel is the channel for transmitting qubit

assign_memory_qubits(*, capacity: int | dict[str, int] = 1)[source]

Assign memory qubits at each node connected to the qchannel.

Parameters:

capacity – required quantity of qubits. If given as an integer, this applies to every node. If given as a dict, it should be a mapping from node name to capacity of this node, where every node connected to the qchannel must appear in the dict.

Raises:

OverflowError - insufficient qubits. –

send(qubit: QuantumModel, next_hop: QNode)[source]

Send a qubit to the next_hop

Parameters:

  • qubit (QuantumModel) – the transmitting qubit

  • next_hop (QNode) – the next hop QNode

Raises:

NextHopNotConnectionException – the next_hop is not connected to this channel

class qns.entity.QuantumMemory(name: str, **kwargs: Unpack[QuantumMemoryInitKwargs])[source]

Bases: Entity

Quantum memory stores qubits or entangled pairs

It has two modes:

Synchronous mode, users can use the read and write function to operate the memory directly without delay Asynchronous mode, users can use events to operate memories asynchronously

allocate(path_id: int, path_direction: PathDirection, *, ch_name: str, n=1) → list[int][source]

Allocate n qubits to a given path ID.

This method searches for n qubits that have not yet been allocated (i.e., path_id is None), assigns them the provided path_id, and returns their addresses.

Parameters:

  • path_id – The identifier of the entanglement path to which the memory qubit will be allocated.

  • ch_name – The name of the quantum channel to which the memory qubit is assigned.

  • path_direction – The end of the path to which the qubit allocated qubit points. This is typically either the source or the destination of the path (LEFT/RIGHT).

Returns:

List of qubit addresses.

Raises:

OverflowError - insufficient unallocated qubits. –

assign(ch: QuantumChannel, n=1) → list[int][source]

Assign n qubits to a particular quantum channel.

This is only used at topology creation time.

Returns:

List of qubit addresses.

Raises:

OverflowError - insufficient unassigned qubits. –

capacity

Memory capacity, i.e. how many qubits can be stored. Each qubit would have an address in [0, capacity).

clear() → None[source]

Clear all qubits in the memory.

property count: int

Return the quantity of stored qubits.

deallocate(*addrs: int) → None[source]

Deallocate one or more qubits from any assigned path.

This method finds the memory qubit with the given address and clears its path assignment (i.e., resets its path_id to None). It does not modify the quantum state or remove the qubit from memory.

decohere_qubit(qubit: MemoryQubit, qm: QuantumModel)[source]

Mark the BaseEntanglement quantum model associated with a qubit as decohered. This is invoked through decoherence event from _schedule_decohere.

  1. Check whether the EPR pair still exists in memory via self.read(key=qm). - If the qubit was already released via swap/purify, it is safely ignored. - If the qubit was re-entangled, it would be associated with a different quantum model

    and would not be found via self.read(key=qm).

  2. If the EPR is still present, set the qubit to RELEASE state, and then schedule a QubitDecoheredEvent to inform the link layer.

Parameters:

  • qubit – The memory qubit that has reached its decoherence time.

  • qm – The assocated quantum model, which must also be an instance of BaseEntanglement.

decoherence_delay

Inverse of decoherence_rate, i.e. duration between EPR creation time and decoherence time in seconds.

delay

Read/write delay, only applicable to async access.

find(predicate: Callable[[MemoryQubit, Any], bool], *, has_epr=False) → Iterator[Any][source]
get(key: int | QuantumModel | str, *, must: bool | None = None) → tuple[MemoryQubit, QuantumModel | None] | None[source]
get_channel_qubits(ch_name: str) → list[tuple[MemoryQubit, QuantumModel | None]][source]

Retrieve all memory qubits associated with a specific quantum channel.

This method returns all memory qubits that are linked to the given quantum channel name, regardless of their state or usage.

Parameters:

ch_name (str) – The name of the quantum channel to filter qubits by.

Returns:

A list of memory qubits (along with their QuantumModel) that are bound to the specified quantum channel.

Return type:

List[Tuple[MemoryQubit, QuantumModel]]

QNode that owns this memory.

This is assigned by QNode.set_memory().

pending_decohere_events: dict[str, Event]

Table of pending decoherence events. Key is BaseEntanglement.name. Value is the decohere event, which should be uncanceled and unexpired.

read(key: int | QuantumModel | str, *, destructive=True, must: bool | None = None) → tuple[MemoryQubit, QuantumModel] | None[source]
unassign(*addrs: int) → None[source]

Unassign one or more qubits from any quantum channel.

update(old_qm: str, new_qm: QuantumModel) → bool[source]

Update the data of a stored qubit without resetting its coherence time.

This method replaces an existing quantum model in memory with a new one, preserving the original decoherence schedule. The old decoherence event is canceled and replaced with a new event for the updated model, but at the same decoherence time.

Parameters:

  • old_qm (str) – The name of the existing QuantumModel to be replaced.

  • new_qm (QuantumModel) – The new QuantumModel instance to store in its place.

Returns:

True if the update was successful, False if old_qm was not found

(e.g., already decohered or removed).

Return type:

bool

Notes

  • If old_qm is not found in memory but a pending decoherence event still exists,

that event is canceled and removed to avoid inconsistency. - This method does not modify the coherence time or reschedule it—only updates the stored quantum model while maintaining timing integrity.

write(qm: QuantumModel, *, path_id: int | None = None, address: int | None = None, key: str | None = None) → MemoryQubit | None[source]

Store a quantum model (e.g., a qubit or an entangled pair) in memory.

  1. Find an unused memory slot that satisfies optional constraints.

  2. Store and provided quantum model.

  3. Schedule a decoherence event based on the memory’s decoherence rate.

Parameters:

  • qm – The quantum model to store (e.g., an entangled pair).

  • path_id – Constrain by MemoryQubit.path_id field (set by allocate).

  • address – Constrain by qubit address.

  • key – Constrain by MemoryQubit.active field (set in LinkLayer reservation).

Returns:

Qubit where the quantum model was stored, or None if no storage available.

class qns.entity.QuantumOperator(name: str, *, node: QNode | None = None, gate: Callable[[...], None | int | list[int]], delay: float | DelayModel = 0)[source]

Bases: Entity

Quantum operator can perform quantum operation or measurements on qubits. It has two modes:

Synchronous mode, users can use the operate function to operate qubits directly without delay Asynchronous mode, users will use events to operate quantum operations asynchronously
